title: The WidevineCDM plugin has crashed

I have never had this problem before so I am not not sure what could be suddenly causing this problem.

title: Youtube se queda un rato cargando en negro siempre al darle a reproducir un video.
content:
No entiendo que pasa, cada vez que intento ver un video se me pega unos 15 20 segundos cargando en negro el video. Tengo fibra, me va a la perfección la velocidad y todo en general. Mi pc tiene menos de 1 mes, tengo 32gb de ram, una grafica 3060 y un i5 12400f, creo que por mi equipo no puede ser, porque es todo nuevo y de buena calidad. He probado 789 cosas, quitar la aceleracion por hardware, ponerla, quitar los complementos, ponerlos y no consigo arreglarlo. Aparte se que debería de cargar muchísimo más rápido porque sorprendentemente en el microsoft edge clickas un video y se abre al instante xd. Porfavor necesito ayuda ya que es un poco tedioso tener que esperar 15 20 segundos cuando se que realmente por todo mi equipo y mi conexión es algo que debería ir perfecto. Me encanta Mozilla y es mi navegador favorito desde hace muchos años pero no entiendo porque pasa esto, no planteo cambiarme pero si esto sigue así quizás tendré que hacerlo (no me gustaría) dado que consumo muchos videos de Youtube. 

Dejo una foto para que veáis como se ven los 15-20 primeros segundos de carga (después de esa carga puedes pasar el video como quieras que se te ve todo al instante sin cargar).

Gracias y perdón por si algo no se entiende o he hecho algo mal poniendo este Post.
creator: german025

title: Garbled font issue not solved with other solutions
content:
My browser displays many websites, emails, etc. using a strange garbled font (see attached image for reference).

I already checked the preference setting for allowing websites to select their own fonts. The issue also persists in Troubleshooting mode. I have also used the "Inspect element" tool when this has occurred, also to no avail. I imagine at this point the only real solution is to delete and reinstall Firefox, but I'd love to hear if someone has another solution! Thanks!

Note that text in bold / italics often shows up just fine. I can also copy-paste any of this text and it displays correctly.

title: How do I stop Firefox from adding items to my bookmarks like "get involved" and "help and tutorials" among other items?
content: Every day, I get multiple bookmarks added to my list that I do not want. They include, among others, things like Get Involved (there are at least dozens of these), About Firefox (again, Dozens), Help and Tutorials (many added). They clog my bookmarks on all things that access Firefox (work computer, home computer, IPhone, IPad) and the only way is to go in an delete them. I don't want nor do I need multiple versions of any of these. For that matter, I don't want even one of each added to my bookmarks. I've looked for help but unless you are a tech expert it's almost impossible to understand how to do that. I just want it to stop or I want to know how to stop it in the simplest way possible.

title: Videy playback stutter
content:
Video playback stutters in Firefox and Firefox Nightly but not in an external player (mpv) or Edge. Hardware acceleration on/off makes no difference. Using the latest Radeon driver 22.11.2. Most noticeable during slow pan like this https://youtube.com/clip/Ugkx7jP_XuVB7i-O6ljGHQ_NjPmEakzvD7yM

The video playback stuttering isn't new but I only stated looking into it now. No idea how long it's been like this. At first I thought it might be caused by running my monitors at true 120Hz and 60Hz instead of a fractional framerate but then the stuttering should be visible on other apps too. Switching to a fractional 60 didn't change anything in Firefox.

title: HTML5 Videos not playing properly in Responsive Design Mode
content:
I'm currently testing my website using FF's RDM, I have HTML 5 video with two sources, one Webm and one MP4 encoded according to the mozilla dev pages' advice on codecs.

The video, when clicking play or the video itself, advances one frame and pauses again under all User Agents bundled into Responsive Design Mode. If I click quickly and repeatedly it will eventually play properly. The thumbnail renders properly and the progress bar indicates that the video has loaded properly.

The video works as intended on Desktop (Windows & Linux), my Pixel 4a (FF & Chrome), my friend's S20FE (One of the UAs in RDM), and StackOverflow doesn't seem to have any input on my code, so the one last thing to check is with people who know more about Responsive Design Mode.

title: Password manager new feature request: Primary timeout required
content:
I would really appreciate if the Firefox Password Manager would time-out and ask me again the primary password every x minutes (lets say 10 minutes, better if configurable). I use Firefox in my home PC, I have two kids (11 and 13 years old) and they frequently use my Linux/Firefox session for their school necessities and leisure time. The problem is that often they end using my session and they have access to all my usn/pwd inside de Password Manger (Internet router configuration, Parental Control configuration, ecc.) My kids have their own Linux profiles and Chrome profiles for school but they usually get to use my own PC/web-browser sessions for practical reasons inside my family.

Thank you very much for your support. Hernan M. Vago

title: Merging Logins, Passwords, etc from different computers, profiles, devices.
content:
Hello world! Is there any documentation explaining if FireFox Sync is the best way to merge different computers and/or devices with different logins saved? And if yes, how to use it (which computer log in first, etc). Has anybody done it and can explain if in the process entries with the same URL were duplicated or if the newer login information overwrote the older one?

I have found this question ALL OVER the internet (phrased differently) and yet, NOT ONE OFFICIAL ANSWER or an unofficial one that actually answers the question. Many well intended volunteers suggest to export and import but then again, there's no information on how the process works. (Duplication or saving Account #1 Over Account #2 or newer over older, etc). How can we get a an official answer? I am sure the coders know how their tool works... why is it so hard to help so many people in need?

For users who have been using FireFox in different computers over the years, it's a VERY REAL problem. Right now, I have to switch between my different devices when searching for passwords as I'm unsure what the Sync would do.... We should not be sorry for having chosen FireFox over other browsers... Thank you.
creator: vramunda
